title: Today's Pickup: Grocery Shoppers Still Prefer Shopping In Stores
text: Good day, While most of society seems to be moving quickly toward online shopping, grocery shoppers remain laggards.

title: Wall St. muted as trade optimism fades
text: Wall Street's main indexes were subdued on Tuesday, as a trade truce-fueled relief rally in the previous session fizzled out after the United States threatened additional tariffs on European goods.

title: Stock Market Sluggish, As Pessimism Lingers On China Trade War
text: Stock market: Overall, U.S. stocks with China exposure were saying, "not so fast.

title: Relief rally fades fears of expanding trade wars
text: The global stocks rally that followed progress on U.S.-China trade relations stalled on Tuesday, pressured by weak manufacturing data from the euro zone and the United States, and as Washington threatened additional tariffs on European goods.

title: Cleveland Fed President Loretta Mester says rates should be kept where they are 'for a while'
text: The central bank official said she holds a "positive baseline outlook" though she is monitoring risks to determine whether the Fed should act.

title: White House trade advisor Peter Navarro: ‘Complicated’ US-China talks ‘will take time’
text: U.S.-China trade talks may have restarted, but a potential deal is still a ways off, White House trade advisor Peter Navarro tells CNBC.

title: Wall St. slips as trade optimism fades
text: U.S. stocks edged lower on Tuesday, a day after a record-setting rally, as optimism sparked by the U.S.-China trade truce waned after Washington threatened tariffs on $4 billion of additional EU goods.

title: Russia says tension in the Persian Gulf is not the fault of Iran
text: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said sanctions on Iran are both unlawful and ineffective.

title: Dow Jones Lower Amid Stock Market Rally; Hot IPO Stock Roku Downgraded
text: The major stock indexes were modestly lower early Tuesday. Hot IPO stock Roku sold off after an analyst downgrade.

title: Bitcoin dives below $10,000, giving up some of this year's epic rally
text: Bitcoin plunged Tuesday to below $10,000, cratering from a 17-month high hit just four sessions ago.

title: Small Biz Employment Trends Soften in June, but Wage Pressures Continue to Rise
text: It’s still too soon to call the U.S. Department of Labor’s unemployment situation report due this Friday, but the Paychex and IHS Markit report called the Small Business Employment Watch showed a drop in June.

title: Economic Optimism Jumps With Dow Jones, China Trade Hopes: IBD/TIPP Poll
text: The IBD/TIPP Economic Optimism Index jumped into strongly optimistic territory to start July on a resurgent Dow Jones and rising China trade deal hopes.

title: Following Victory Lap, Is Market Turning On Cruise Control Ahead Of Friday Jobs Data?
text: Following Monday’s flight to new highs as trade tensions eased, the markets face a holiday-shortened week highlighted by Friday’s jobs report.

title: 6 Times These Big Investors Probably Said 'Whoops!'

title: Propriety Reverse Mortgage Products Could Eclipse FHA's HECM Program in 2019
text: New mortgage products focused on home equity release for seniors primed for a market boost as sales falter with the government's HECM.

title: Wall St. set to open flat as trade talk euphoria fades
text: U.S. stock index futures indicated to a flat opening on Tuesday, a day after the benchmark S&P 500 index hit a record high, as optimism sparked by the U.S.-China trade truce waned and a fresh threat of tariffs on Europe kept investors on edge.

title: 'Dr. Doom' economist Nouriel Roubini sees trade war tipping global economy into a recession
text: The rivalry between the U.S. and China could be so disruptive that it's starting to decouple the global economy and eventually causing a recession, according to Nouriel Roubini.

title: Why The Bond Market Is Behaving Like My Cats
text: The bond market is acting like my two cats, Rose and Joey. There are moments of calm, followed by short bouts of furious activity.

title: Why Does OPEC Even Hold Meetings?
text: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) has officially agreed to extend its production cuts for an additional nine months.

title: Stock Allocations Decline For A Second Month
text: Individual investors’ exposure to equity allocations declined for a second consecutive month.

title: This is now the longest US economic expansion in history
text: The ongoing U.S. economic expansion has entered its 121st month, marking the longest run on record going back to 1854.

title: Futures dip after rally as trade talk euphoria fades
text: U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Tuesday, a day after the benchmark S&P 500 index hit a record high, as optimism over progress in U.S.-China trade talks subsided and a fresh threat of tariffs on Europe kept investors on edge.

title: Considering Company Age May Boost Returns By 4% A Year According To Recent Research
text: New research shows that company age can be an important factor in picking stocks. Selecting stocks that are older than average, can help investment performance.

title: Scotch Whisky Association urges U.S. and EU to end trade stand-off
text: The Scotch Whisky Association on Tuesday urged the United States and the European Union to end a trade dispute and avoid harmful tariffs that would damage both economies after Washington threatened tariffs on $4 billion goods including the spirit.

title: EU says it is open to talks with U.S. in row over aircraft subsidies
text: The European Union said on Tuesday it is open to talks with United States in a row over aircraft subsidies but said figures quoted by Washington as it threatened more tariffs were based on internal U.S. estimates.

title: Cannabis sector could grow to $200 billion in a decade, say Stifel analysts
text: The cannabis sector offers a $200 billion global opportunity in the next decade, up from the roughly $8 billion that was generated in 2018 in federall legal markets and U.S. state licensed sales, Stifel analysts wrote Tuesday in a new report.

title: OPEC and allies extend oil supply cut in bid to boost prices
text: OPEC and its allies led by Russia agreed to extend oil output cuts until March 2020 on Tuesday seeking to prop up the price of crude as the global economy weakens and U.S. production soars.

title: OPEC allies agree to extend supply cuts in a bid to support oil prices
text: The decision comes less than 24 hours after OPEC thrashed out a deal to restrict the amount of crude flowing into the global market.

title: Huawei reportedly isn't sure about using Android in future phones     - CNET
text: It's waiting for the Commerce's Department approval to use Google's OS after President Donald Trump agreed to ease restrictions.

title: Gold Resumes Trek Higher As Weak Economic Data Point To Stimulus
text:
Gold rebounded from its biggest decline in more than two years on signs of fresh strains on the global economy which may prompt stimulus from central banks.
The post Gold Resumes Trek Higher As Weak Economic Data Point To Stimulus appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Stocks Drift As Investors Mull Trade; Bonds Climb: Markets Wrap

title: Oil price 'could easily be $75' if trade truce boosts demand, expert says
text: The success, or failure, of trade talks between the U.S. and China will be a decisive factor for oil, Amrita Sen said.

title: Oil prices climb as OPEC extends cuts, but demand worries persist
text: Oil gained on Tuesday as producer club OPEC agreed to extend supply cuts until next March, although prices were pressured by worries demand could ease amid hints of a slowdown in the global economy.

title: 10-year Treasury yield falls back below 2%, global yields sink deeper into negative territory
text: The 10-year Treasury yield fell back under 2% on Tuesday as concerns about global economic growth pushed investors toward safer assets.

title: Locked out of China, U.S. pork producers sniff out new buyers

title: Soaring Manhattan real estate sales could be a mirage
text: Sales of Manhattan real estate jumped for the first time in a year and a half, but the good times aren't likely to last.
